title: sans serif similar to Gill Sans on cover of book
author: whatsmytype

comments.content: I kind of don't think so, as Syntax appears to have an upper case "W" that has angled edges at the top. Also, the upper case "S" in the picture I uploaded appears to be more squashy and horizontal?
Oh, that's it! It has a quirky upper case "Q" that's pretty eye-catching, which appears all through the book as body copy. Thank you, both! Very cool font!

Wish I could post both your names in the "Solved By" field, but Typophile won't let me. Will have to chose one of you, so I guess it'll have to be kthomps5 as he/she appears first in the postings, but really it's a tie!
